Event.name: Institutionalization
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Patient</fen> is committed to the care of a medical <fen>Facility</fen> by a proper <fen>Authority</fen>. Regardless of whether the <fen>Patient</fen> agrees or does not agree with their placement in the <fen>Facility</fen>, the <fen>Authority</fen> judges that it is in the best interest of the <fen>Patient</fen> or his environment that the <fen>Patient</fen> receive treatment in the <fen>Facility</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Time">Ten years after Abraham Lincoln's assassination</fex>, <fex name="aut">a Chicago court</fex> declared his 56-year-old widow Mary insane and <t>committed</t> <fex name="pat">her</fex> <fex name="fac">to a mental institution</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="pat">A pregnant woman</fex> was <t>hospitalized</t> <fex name="dep">with gunshots to her shoulder and abdomen</fex>. <fex name="aut">CNI</fex> <fex name="fac">INI</fex></ex>
<ex>Arberg issued a two-sentence statement saying <fex name="pat">Rehnquist</fex> was <t>hospitalized</t> <fex name="aff">for a fever</fex> and undergoing tests. <fex name="aut">CNI</fex> <fex name="fac">INI</fex></ex>
<ex>The <t>hospitalization</t> <fex name="pat">of the Saudi king</fex> upset the skittish oil markets. <fex name="aut">INI</fex> <fex name="fac">INI</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Patient
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person who is committed to a facility with a view towards helping them mentally or physically.
<ex>Buffy's got this hospital phobia because her caring parents <t>institutionalized</t> <fex name="pat">her</fex> for a while before she moved to Sunnydale.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Facility
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The facility where the <fen>Patient</fen> is taken for treatment.
<ex>Unfortunately for Mrs. Lincoln, her son, Robert, <t>institutionalized</t> her <fex name="fac">in the Batavia Asylum</fex> shortly after the visit to St. Charles.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Authority
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Authority</fen> is the actor carrying out the institutionalization with proper legal authorization, either invested into them in general by the government or granted due to power of attorney over the <fen>Patient</fen>.
<ex>Goodrum then went to see <fex name="aut">a private doctor</fex> <fex name="aut">who</fex> <t>hospitalized</t> him.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Affliction
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The condition exhibited by the <fen>Patient</fen>, which is deemed to merit institutionalization by the <fen>Authority</fen>.
<ex>Her parents <t>institutionalized</t> her <fex name="aff">for what was essentially typical bad adolescent behavior</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time interval during which the institutionalization happens.
<ex><fex name="Time">Later</fex> her mother became depressed and was <t>institutionalized</t>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The purpose of the institutionalization.
<ex>His squabbling parents would rather <t>institutionalize</t> him <fex name="pur">to rid themselves of their problem</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Authority</fen> that brings about the institutionalization of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
<ex>Without informing Volkobraun or her attorney of the court's decision, police <fex name="Mns">forcibly</fex> <t>committed</t> her to a psychiatric hospital.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the institutionalization event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Authority</fen> that affect the action (<ment>ruthlessly</ment>).
<ex>St Remy, of course, is most noted for being the place where Van Gogh <t>committed</t> himself <fex name="man">voluntarily</fex> to an asylum.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> denotes a proposition from which the occurrence of the institutionalization event logically follows.</def-root>

Arg.name: Duration_of_final_state
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the length of the time period for which the <fen>Authority</fen> has placed the <fen>Patient</fen> in the <fen>Facility</fen>.
<ex>This time, physicians <t>hospitalized</t> him <fex name="dur">for more than a month</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location in which the <fen>Facility</fen> is situated.
<ex>The widow of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. suffered a stroke on Wednesday, and was <t>hospitalized</t> <fex name="pla">in Atlanta</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE describes a participant of the institutionalization as being in some state during the action.
<ex>A man was <t>hospitalized</t> <fex name="dep">in stable condition</fex> after he was mauled by a ?pet? bear.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE marks the amount of times the <fen>Patient</fen> is committed to the <fen>Facility</fen> per unit of time.</def-root>
